intro: Veronica austriaca subsp. virescens, commonly known as the green Veronica, is a perennial flowering plant native to Central Europe. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features upright stems covered in fine, hairy hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to purple flowers that bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, velvety texture, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shady garden settings.
